intro: Thlaspi nevadense, commonly known as mountain cabbages, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species typically grows in rocky soils at high elevations, often in alpine or subalpine environments. Its small, white or yellowish flowers are clustered in racemes, and it produces small, rounded seeds. Thlaspi nevadense is adapted to cold climates and is often found in meadows and open slopes.
